Package me.gamercoder215.mobchip.attributes

Class Attribute

java.lang.Object
me.gamercoder215.mobchip.attributes.Attribute
public abstract class Attribute extends Object
Represents an extendible Attribute

  • Constructor Details

    • Attribute

      protected Attribute(@NotNull @NotNull ChipRegistry.RegistryKey id) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs an Attribute, with min, max, and default all being 1.
      Parameters:
      id - Registry ID, cannot be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ID is null or value is greater than 64

    • Attribute

      protected Attribute(@NotNull @NotNull ChipRegistry.RegistryKey id, double defaultValue) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs an Attribute, with min, max, and default all the same.
      Parameters:
      id - Registry ID, cannot be null
      defaultValue - Default value of Attribute
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ID is null or value is greater than 64

    • Attribute

      protected Attribute(@NotNull @NotNull ChipRegistry.RegistryKey id, double defaultValue, double min, double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs an Attribute.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of Attribute
      defaultValue - Default Value of Attribute
      min - Minimum Value of Attribute
      max - Maximum Value of Attribute
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ID is null, value is greater than 64, min greater than max, max less than min, or defaultValue less than min || defaultValue greater than max

  • Method Details

    • getId

      @NotNull public final @NotNull ChipRegistry.RegistryKey getId()
      Returns the ID of this Attribute.

      Ex: player.strength

      Returns:
      ID of this Attribute.

    • getDefaultValue

      public final double getDefaultValue()
      Get the Default Value of this Attribute.
      Returns:
      Default Value

    • setDefaultValue

      public final void setDefaultValue(double defaultValue) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the Default value of this Attribute.
      Parameters:
      defaultValue - New Default Value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if less than min or greater than max

    • getMinValue

      public final double getMinValue()
      Get the Minimum Value of this Attribute.
      Returns:
      Current Minimum Value, or getDefaultValue() if not set

    • getMaxValue

      public final double getMaxValue()
      Get the Maximum Value of this Attribute.
      Returns:
      Current Maximum Value, or getDefaultValue() if not set

    • setMaxValue

      public final void setMaxValue(double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the Maximum Value of this Attribute
      Parameters:
      max - New Maximum Value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if max is less than the current min

    • setMinValue

      public final void setMinValue(double min) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the Minimum Value of this Attribute
      Parameters:
      min - New Minimum Value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if min is more than the current max

    • setMinMaxValue

      public final void setMinMaxValue(double min, double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets both the Maximum and Minimum Value of this Attribute.

      Useful for when changing both at once.

      Parameters:
      min - New Minimum Value
      max - New Maximum Value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given minimum is less than given maximum

    • create

      @NotNull public static final @NotNull Attribute create(@NotNull @NotNull ChipRegistry.RegistryKey key, double defaultValue, double min, double max)
      Creates a Custom Attribute.
      Parameters:
      key - RegistryKey to use
      defaultValue - Default Value of Attribute
      min - Minimum Value
      max - Maximum Value
      Returns:
      Created Attribute
      See Also:
      • Attribute(RegistryKey, double, double, double)
